lines.text:
[referring to Lillian]
Mother's spells run hot and cold. Maybe she is going through the change?
How dare she insult my witchcraft! Oh, is it hot in here?
Well, Lillian, let's examine the evidence first. You get us stuck here, now you've brought Cinderella. Next I suppose it will be Goldilocks and The Three Bears, then what are you going to do?
We'll buy some porridge... OK?
Cinderella always has a happy ending, and so do Snow White and Prince Charming
You mean we can all go back to the Enchanted Forrest?
Of course, I have my pumpkin coach right outside.
Snow, did you hear that?
We can go home.
Now everyone hurry and pack because the coach turns into a pumpkin at the stroke of 11.
I thought it was midnight?
That's EFT "Enchanted Forest Time"
Have I ever told you how I met your mother, son?
A million times. Grandma gave Mom a poison apple, you rode along on your white horse and kissed her, and woke her up.

[to Eric]
Honey, somehow it sounds better when you tell it.
You left out the best part, that's how I've awakened her ever since.
[Eric and Snow kiss]
Why don't you get an alarm clock like everyone else!
After the game these guys usually go out together, they drink beer, eat pizza, tell off color jokes, and have belching contests.
Why?
It's what they call male bonding.
Well, Eric will just have to bond another time because he told me he's coming to my meeting.
Honey, none of the husbands go to these things. What makes you think you're married to the only prince?
Trust me!
Mother, you shouldn't be doing bad deeds this close to Christmas, you want to be on your best behavior for Santa.
Santa? You two still believe in Santa? Oh this is rich.
Why shouldn't we believe in him?
Hasn't he come every year on Christmas Eve?
This is not the Enchanted Forrest, this is the Twentieth Century. There are no wishing wells, no pot of gold at the end of the rainbow, and certainly no Santa Claus.

[knocks on the door, then enters]
Hi, you guys want to come to the mall to see Santa Claus?
Has anyone ever told you that you are a cold, heartless woman?
Yes, but I never tire of hearing it!
Fairy Godmother, I really want to go home.
Oh, stop your whining and go look for your shoes!
Perhaps now you realize that good will overcome evil.
Oh, blow it out your wand!

[Lillian has been called in for an IRS audit, and is speaking to herself]
They're not going to intimidate me, they're not going to intimidate me, they're not going to intimidate me.
Next!
[points to Lillian]
You can't do anything to me, I've done nothing wrong.
I hear that all the time. When it comes to tax fraud, everyone swears they're "lilly white."
But I am Lilly White!
Sure, sure, sure. Now sit down!
I'm warning you, I'm a witch!
Oh, yeah? So is my wife. Now, you say you're self employed. Doing what?
Doing this.
[she makes the lamp on the desk levitate]
Not bad. But I saw that on a Bud Light commercial.
[Lillian then zaps up a huge snake]
Any other dependents?
Tough room!
[zaps the snake away]
Now look, lady, I've been doing this for 22 years. I've seen it all, I've heard it all. Now where did you get the money?
I tapped into the credit system through my magic mirror.
Ok, I haven't heard it all.
Luther, guess what I am getting Snow for our anniversary?
Wall to wall carpeting?
No, we're getting a car!
All right! A new set of wheels.
No not just the wheels, the whole thing. This is going to be the best anniversary ever! Right, Snow?
Oh Eric, what about what mother said?
Honey, I would much rather get you a car than a muzzle.
No. About when it comes to cars, you don't know diddly.
Oh, that. Honey don't worry. You know it's like making any decision, you get some good solid advice from someone you know you can trust.
Like who?
[Snow, Eric and Luther then watch a commercial playing on their TV]

[dressed as Abraham Lincoln]
Need help buying a car? Then see me, Abraham Jones, AKA "Honest Abe." The honest used car salesman. Don't be a slave to that old jalopy, let me emancipate you into a beautiful new used car. Take it from me, "Honest Abe." Why, if I can't give you the best deal in town, I'll eat a log cabin!
Honey, I think we found our man!
